intro: Rhodanthe atropurpurea, commonly known as the purple glory flower, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the daisy family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its striking purple to reddish-pink flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has silvery-gray foliage that helps it retain moisture. Its flowers bloom in winter and spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and birds. Rhodanthe atropurpurea is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is well-suited to coastal gardens.
